intro: Phlegmariurus harmsii, commonly known as the Harms' clubmoss, is a species of lycophyte belonging to the family Lycopodaceae. It is characterized by its small, erect, spore-bearing cones and its distinctive, branching structure. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are scale-like and closely appressed to the stems, contributing to its compact appearance. Phlegmariurus harmsii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
